result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam D. Wendorf

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Adam D. Wendorf
Current: 1306 E 10th St, Merrill, WI 54452 United States  (Effective: 04-27-2016)
Prior: W5821 Hillside Dr, Merrill, WI 54452 United States
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CM2149, 15CM281, 15CM293, 15CM386 called: 1:30pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner.  Def appears in person and with Atty Kat Jackan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
14CM2149 - Cts 1 and 2>>D&RI
14CM2149 - Ct. 3 (DC/DA)>>AMEND to Delete Domestic Abuse allegation
15CM281>>D&RI entire file
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
14CM2149 - Ct. 3 (DC)>>NO CONTEST
15CM293 - Ct. 1 (Misd BJ)>>NO CONTEST
15CM386 - Ct. 1 (Misd BJ)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on all 3 counts; 1 year probation on each count, concurrent to each other
CONDITIONS: Defendant to complete SAFE program; AODA and any other assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Absoluete sobriety; No possession of any controlled substance unless valid prescription and then only as listed on prescription; CC; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling and at any time defendant does not meet that standard he must complete 10 hours of CS/week; N/C with victim S.G.

>>Defendant has 18 days credit if revoked
>>COURT orders restitution hearing to be set in 14CM2149 case.
>>Atty Jackan requests cash bond be returned to surety - COURT grants.

Adj: 1:41pm

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:48am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person and with Atty Kat Jackan.

State notes JT set for 5/12 and parties have agreement as to most of the motions
COURT has defense MIL w/14 subparts and State's 4/27/15 MIL w/7 subparts, and another MIL by State regarding prior convictions for impeachment purposes.

STATE's MIL>>
COURT questions Atty Jackan re: agreement with State's MIL - Defense stipulates to 1-5 and 7; COURT grants each of those (1-5 and 7)
As to #6, State will ensure COURT makes inquiry before the start of trial as requested by COURT.

STATE's MIL re: prior convictions>>
COURT questions State regarding  number of convictions of defendant State is requesting be answered to if defendant so choses during trial 
Argument by Attorney Jackan and requests that no convictions be testified to by defendant if he choses during trial.
COURT makes findings - COURT makes rulings, and number should be 4 if defendant testifies for impeachment purposes.

DEFENDANT's MIL>>
State agrees to all except 5 and 11, and leave 13 to COURT's discretion; COURT grants 1-4, 6-10, 12 and 14
COURT makes ruling on 13 and notes all instructions go to jury when deliberating.
COURT makes ruling on 11 - COURT grants and all witnesses to be instructed as such.
COURT addresses #5 (911 call) -- State does not have intent to use during trial; COURT grants, but reiterates rules that issues must be raised outside the presence of jury if necessary.
Bond continues.
Parties to check with JA re: if trial is #1 for 5/12

Adj: 9:04am

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CM2149, 15CM281, 15CM293, 15CM386 called: 3:10pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Kat Jackan.


Parties note agreement has NOT been reached in this matter.
COURT questions parties as to discovery and if any motions will be filed before trial; Parties note discovery has recently been turned over on newest case.
COURT directs parties to set another PTC in approx 10 days.

COURT leaves FPT/JT dates on court's calendar
Bond continues.

Adj: 3:12pm
org warrant returned from Sheriff's dept

INCLUDES 15CM281, 15CM293, & 15CM386   No contact with victim(s): S.G.-NON WAIVABLE. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
Defendant did not appear for initial appearance.
Defendant did not appear for initial appearance.
